intro: Selago congesta, commonly known as the clustered selago, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. Selago congesta is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ability to withstand salty air.
